Detailed Description

This class is used to accessing and modifying preference data.

ApplicationPreferences is allows you to save and retrieve persistent key-value pairs of primitive data types like: bool, float, int32_t, int64_t, and String. This data will persist even you close the application.

The following example demonstrates how to use the ApplicationPreferences

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const savedInstanceState) {

     // new Context instance
     Context* context = new Context(this);

     // Get ApplicationPreferences instance
     content::ApplicationPreferences* preference =
         context->getApplicationPreferencesN(content::ApplicationPreferences::MODE_ALL_WRITE);

     // Set values
     preference->setInt("int32_t_key", 1000);
     preference->setBool("bool_key", true);
     preference->setFloat("float_key", 0.123);
     preference->setString("string_key", "this is String value");

     // Save modify int32_to persistent storage.
     preference->save();

     // Get values
     int32_t int32_t_value = preference->getInt("int32_t_key", 0);
     bool bool_value = preference->getBool("bool_key", 0.0);
     float float_value = preference->getFoat("float_key", 0.0);
     gaia::base::String string_value = preference->getString("string_key", "default value");

     // Check if contains key first
     if (preference->contains("int32_t_key")) {
         // Remove value
         preference->remove("int32_t_key");

         // Save modify int32_to persistent storage.
         preference->save();
     }

 }
See also:
IApplicationPreferencesChangeListener

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum gaia::content::ApplicationPreferences::preference_mode [private]

preference permission mode.

Enumerator:
MODE_SELF 

preference permission.

The created file can only be accessed by the calling process.

See also:
MODE_ALL_READ
MODE_ALL_WRITE
MODE_ALL_READ 

preference permission.

The created file can only be writed by the calling process, but can be read by other process in the same package.

See also:
MODE_SELF
MODE_ALL_WRITE
MODE_ALL_WRITE 

preference permission.

Every process in the same package can read/write.

See also:
MODE_SELF
MODE_ALL_READ

Member Function Documentation

void gaia::content::ApplicationPreferences::clear ( ) const [private]

Mark in the ApplicationPreferences to remove all values from the preferences.

Once save is called, the only remaining preferences will be any that you have defined in this ApplicationPreferences.

Note that when saving back to the preferences, the clear is done first, regardless of whether you called clear before or after put methods on this ApplicationPreferences.

bool gaia::content::ApplicationPreferences::contains ( const base::String &  key) const [private]

Checks whether the ApplicationPreferences contains a preference with the specific key.

Returns:
true if the preference exists in the preferences, otherwise false.
Parameters:
[in]keyThe key of the preference to check.
